meanings.definition: A statement at the end of a book giving information about its production.
meanings.sent1: The colophon in the book told me who printed it.
meanings.sent2: I always read the colophon to learn about the book's creation.
meanings.sent3: The colophon made me chuckle with its detailed printer's notes.
meanings.sent4: The colophon was like a hidden gem, revealing the book's secrets.
meanings.sent5: The colophon stood out, making the book more interesting.

meanings.definition: An inscription placed at the end of a book or manuscript.
meanings.sent1: In the old manuscript, the colophon revealed the author's name.
meanings.sent2: The colophon at the end of the book was beautifully written.
meanings.sent3: I found a funny doodle in the colophon of the book.
meanings.sent4: The colophon was a signature of the author's work.
meanings.sent5: The colophon added a touch of elegance to the book.
